title: Thunderbird wiederherstellen

content:
Lange Zeit habe ich problemlos mit Thunderbird gearbeitet. Plötzlich kommt eine Fehlermeldung und nichts geht mehr: sehr ärgerlich. Ermöglichen Sie bitte umgehend den erneuten Zugang! Mit freundlichen Grüßen Wolfgang Beu

P.S.: Eine Vielzahl von gespeicherten E-Mails habe ich inzwischen gelöscht; daran kann es also nicht liegen!

title: Thunderbird Excessive Memory Use - Over 3GB
creator: firefox3254
content:
My TB 147.0.2 Release channel is using excessive amounts of memory. Below is the memory usage data.

Previously I was on the ESR channel for many years. Also I originally used the Lightning calendar plug.

What I'm seeing is that when TB starts the memory usage is high. If I check at another time on the same day it is sometimes only around 250-350MB.

I've tried suggest options like reducing data in Local Folders (on a separate data drive) but to no avail. As I type now TB memory usage is now only 286.4MB. However rest assured in a while this will jump back to over 3GB and it has an is now 3,151.4MB.

I don't see this on another 2 PCs. One is setup with Locals Folders and the other is just the mail Inbox and sub folders. The only other difference is that the PC with this TB installation also has one Newsgroup server configured.

There surely has to be a bug somewhere causing these excessive memory usages.

title: Unsolicited emails not marked as read
creator: philsdream
content:
Hi all,

I use SpamAssassin but even "When Thunderbird determines that they are unwanted" has been ticked" no one of my spams are not marked as read ?!?!

This is annoying, is it a bug or something I missed?

What can I do ?

Thanks in advance for your help.

Best regards.

Philippe

creator: hor.schneider
content: Hello, i want to integrate my dates from a Google Calendar on my smart phone (Samsung) in the calendar from Thunderbird (Version 147.0.2 64 Bit). Is it possible an how to do it? Greetings from Horst

title: When Thunderbird starts up, all folders and sub-folders open up. New install on new disk. Old copy rarely did.
creator: david.ledger
content: Since loading a fresh copy of Thunderbird on a new bigger disk on my Ubuntu laptop, whenever I start it up it opens up all my email folders and sub-folders. I have lots, and it takes time to collapse them all manually. I monitor two other email accounts for a club which also have quite a few folders and sub-folders - same happens on all of them. This did happen occasionally with my old version, but happens every time now with 140.7.1esr (64-bit) running under ubuntu-snap-build - 1.0.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/145.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;tb_version:140.7.1esr (64-bit);os:Ubuntu 24 - as a  Snap

title: How do I select a specific calendar to unsubscribe?
creator: jimcandela
content:
I have several different local calendars set up in my Thunderbird. I want to unsubscribe to a specific one. When I select "Unsubscribe from Selected Calendar" from the Events and Tasks drop down, the Calendar selected is not the one I want to subscribe from. How do I select the Calendar I want to unsubscribe from prior to selecting that menu option. I have searched through the forums and have found references to opening a Calendar tab and right clicking on the left pane to select a Calendar. When I right click on the Calendar tab, I just get the options to Open in New tab or close the current tab. I'm not understanding something and I'd appreciate any clarification on this step. I am including a screen shot that shows the Unsubscribe screen. The calendar that is selected is my Google calendar, but I don't want to unsubscribe from Google. I want to unsubscribe from a duplicate local calendar. How do I do that? 

 Thanks!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;tb_version:140.7.2esr (64-bit);os:Windows 11;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/appearance-panel-layout-message-list-card-view-tab"]

title: comment retrouver le mot de passe de thunderbird
creator: pm.griveaux
content: Je veux installer thunderbird sur un autre ordinateur, lors de l'installation il me demande le mot de passe, je ne le connais plus comment faire ?
